title: How to Delete, Choose, & Change Bumble Prompts

steps.title: To get to know you better, you're asked to write more.
steps.content: To get to know you better, you're asked to write more. Prompts eliminate the "New here" or "I'll do this later" fillers in bios by giving you something to answer or fill in the blank. With specific questions, you have the opportunity to spill about your favorite TV show or list your turn-offs. You can provide examples to showcase your personality if you answer them honestly. [1] X Research source You can add up to three different prompts on your profile.

steps.title: Open Bumble.
steps.content: Open Bumble. This app icon looks like a yellow beehive. This works for Androids as well as iOS phones and tablets.

steps.title: Tap the grey silhouette.
steps.content: Tap the grey silhouette. It's your profile icon in the bottom left corner of your screen. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Edit Profile.
steps.content: Tap Edit Profile . It's below your profile picture near the top of your screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the profile prompt you want to change.
steps.content: Tap the profile prompt you want to change. You'll find this under the "Profile Prompts" header. You can have up to three prompts on your profile. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Replace or Update.
steps.content: Tap Replace or Update . You can choose to either change the prompt completely to a new prompt, or you can update your current answer. If you opt to replace the prompt, tap a new prompt to select it. On the next screen, answer the prompt or fill in the blank and tap the yellow checkmark. If you chose to update your answer, change the original text as desired, then tap the yellow checkmark in the top right corner.

steps.title: My ideal night out.
steps.content: My ideal night out. Use this to show others what sort of night you prefer. Do you want to go out shopping, to a movie, or relax with a home-cooked meal? [5] X Research source If you like something niche, like doing goat yoga, list that and everyone looking at your profile will have a sense that you enjoy goats and yoga.

steps.title: Two truths, one lie.
steps.content: Two truths, one lie. This can be an easy answer that can either be silly, boring, or serious. You can use this prompt to boast about some things you've accomplished and something on your bucket list. The best answers are those that are hard to figure out and aren't weird, cliche, uninteresting, reckless, or hateful.

steps.title: Nightclub or Netflix.
steps.content: Nightclub or Netflix. You can use this prompt to show if you're more extroverted or a homebody, which is useful when others are looking for a partner! [6] X Research source It's good to note that a simple one-worded answer that this seems to require doesn't necessarily limit you to a one-word answer. You can instead give an entire example about preferring one over the other!

steps.title: Beach or Mountains.
steps.content: Beach or Mountains. This is similar to the "Nightclub or Netflix" prompt because your answer isn't limited to one word. You can write as much as you like to explain how you would pick one instead of the other.

steps.title: If I could have only three things on a deserted island.
steps.content: If I could have only three things on a deserted island. Prompts like this one are designed for you to express the most important things to you, and it could come up in a message from a potential partner because it's a great way to break the ice! [7] X Research source How you answer this question gives others an idea of your state of mind. Did you answer strategically? Or are you self-deprecating and funny instead? In summary, you can use almost any prompt. But answering a question with one word or something cliche and unoriginal could make an interesting prompt fall flat. For example, the answer to "If I had an extra hour in the day I wouldâ€¦" can be extremely interesting or boring (like if you answer "sleep" or "do laundry").
